commitResults.messageTitle: Added additional checks to prevent invalid arguments such as "/fromtest" rather than "/from", from working, Updated test cases
Added delete, Added index not an int exceptions for mark, unmark and delete, Updated test cases

commitResults.messageBody:
There is no functionality to ensure the existence of the taskList file
or its parent directory.

This results in potential errors when attempting to read or write to the
taskList file if the required file or directory does not exist.

Let's,
* check for the existence of the task list file and its directory
* create the file and directory if they do not already exist

There is no functionality to load tasks from taskList file into the
application.

This results in the application being unable to retrieve and initialize
tasks from previously saved data.

Let's,
* read taskList file
* parse each line to appropriate task type
* mark tasks as done if indicated

commitResults.messageTitle: Bug Fix: Adjust loadTaskList try-catch scope
commitResults.messageBody:
Try-catch of loadTaskList function spanned the function, possibly
catching errors generated outside of the intended scope of reading file
lines.

Let's
* extract task type parsing from try-catch

There is no functionality to save task items into the data file.

This results in the application being unable to retrieve data between
runs.

The save functionality needs to be able to account for different task
operations such as creating new entry, removing entry and marking as
done.

Let's
* add an overwrite file function
* add an append file function
* add a method for tasks to parse into the appropriate file format

The code did not utilize the overwriteTaskListFile and the
appendTaskListFile function.

This resulted in it not saving the task list file.

Let's
* Add usage of append to addTask function
* Add usage of overwrite to delete, mark and unmark functions

commitResults.messageTitle: Convert deadline & events to use LocalDateTime
commitResults.messageBody:
Deadlines and events use strings to represent datetime. This results in
difficulty handling and manipulating them.

Utilizing LocalDateTime would ensure ease in formatting.

Let's
* Update deadline and event class to use LocalDateTime
* Add checks when adding tasks to ensure format dd/mm/yyyy hhmm is used
* Update text output to use a format identical to Oct 2 2019 2:10pm
* Update file output to use dd/mm/yyyy hhmm for ease of parsing on load

Newly added local date time did not match with test cases, resulted in
failed test cases.

Let's
* Update test cases to use localDateTime
* Include new cases to check for invalid date time inputs
